bibl.title: House-to-House Enquiries: An Interdisciplinary Approach to Roman Karanis.
bibl.note: Expanded version of a paper given at the Annual Meeting of the Archaeological Institute of America at New Orleans, December 30, 1992. - i. The University of Michigan excavations at Karanis. - ii. The quality and potential of the archaeological data: the house-by-house approach. - iii. Integration and meaning in Karanis: the family-by-family approach. - iv. Houses and households: sampling Karanis and Pompeii. - v. An example of analysis: the house of Socrates. - vi. Conclusion. - Appendix: List of objects found in house B17.
VAN MINNEN Peter, House-to-House Enquiries: An Interdisciplinary Approach to Roman Karanis.
ZPE 100 (1994) pp. 227-251, 3 figg. et pll. X-XIV.
